caption: This place, no matter what season of the year, will always look impressive and will impress anyone. The contrast between the modern versus the classic is remarkable. The place is clean and safe. It is centric, easy to reach and for free.

I visit this area quite a lot and sometimes I lile to stop off in the gardens if it's not too busy as sometimes it's just too crazy. I absolutely love the lines of trees as it looks so cool. The benches here all have quotes from poets or authors which is pretty cool. The flowers are well maintained and super pretty. There are alot of cafes and restaurants veering off the gardens so always nice to grab a coffee and watch the world go byðŸ˜Š
Peaceful retreat surrounded by historic galleries. You can enjoy a cup of coffee while admiring the beauty and peace of the gardens.
A beautiful garden to walk by as we made our way to the Louvre.  Great variety of flowers.

Do as the locals do and stroll though this lovely park, grab a chair at the fountain and do the soul searching youâ€™ve been meaning to do for awhile. Alternatively you could people watch or start writing chapter 1 of your novel.
Beautiful little garden that has small benches and a fountain to sit by. Great for floral, trees, and column pictures!
Tranquil garden surrounded by cafes and art galleries (selling art). Great place to visit as part of a walking tour around Paris l.

Beautiful Garden. It's funny that having lived in Paris for decades I had never known this place. It was only when I returned to Paris this September that I finally had fortunately the time to walk around and discover this place. Peaceful, rejuvenating and magnificent.
Jardin du Palais Royal is such a lovely place! It quickly became one of my favorite spots on my Euro trip. The serene atmosphere and beautiful gardens make it a perfect escape from the city bustle.

The garden has its charm witht the trees well-trimmed. It's so nice to chill out here reading a book, eating something or just sitting and contemplate the surrounding area. The pillars are quite a beautiful sight. There's one pillar where you can throw a coin and ask for a wish. The coin must stay on top of that pillar and not fall in the water. Try a 5 cent or 10 cent coin, it's almost guaranteed that it won't fall.
Wonderful place to take pictures, recommend visiting during the afternoon.

Jardin du Palais Royal in Paris is a serene oasis nestled in the heart of the city, offering a perfect blend of historical charm and modern artistry. One of its standout features is the striking installation of white and black marble columns, known as "Les Deux Plateaux" or "Colonnes de Buren." Created by artist Daniel Buren, these columns create a captivating visual contrast against the classical architecture of the surrounding Palais Royal. The playful yet elegant arrangement of these marbles invites visitors to engage with the space, making it a favorite spot for both locals and tourists. This unique blend of history and contemporary art makes the Jardin du Palais Royal a must-visit destination in
A beautiful place. Really recommended to everyone to visit. Sitting in peace in the park and enjoying the silence in the sun with the birds chirping.
A garden with beautiful flowers and plants. Here you can have a picnic away from the city and enjoy the buildings around you. Highly recommended.
A really beautiful and quiet garden to relax in and read books.
Stunning and serene. A must-visit, especially during spring. Magnolia in bloom in mid-March, as well as plenty of other flowers. A very calming place in the heart of Paris, very picturesque.
Too beautiful to be trueâ€¦who doesn't love Paris and her gardensâ€¦.? Breath taking.â€¦.

This a relaxing, quite, clean and green garden to visit during daytime to enjoy your break, lunch or walk, jog and meet your friends. There are pet free zones, and zones friendly for your kids to walk in. There are restaurants on the sides to order and eat your meal. I really enjoyed my time there, it was a really nice unplanned surprise on my daytime.
The park chairs were not comfortable, some people smoked. But it is nice watching people chilling, chatting and reading under the sun.

Perfect on a sunny day......However it is incredibly busy especially around lunch, time, we love coming here with our ham and cheese baguette in hand, to sit under the leafy greenery, even though it is busy, there always seems to be a spare seating.

Just go there when you need to be by yourself, just sitting down there reading a book, eat my healthy avocado sandwich ðŸ¥ª and contemplating about life. Beautiful and affordable pleasant place, underrated and not too crowded. â€¦
Beautiful park. Not too crowded in the morning
Very beautiful garden. Worth a visit when the weather is good
Awesome place to visit and relax! Cool Emily in Paris filming location as well.

Such a nice and beautiful place which is not far from Louvre museum there is a lot of photo spot there. You can also sit and chill having coffee there also have a cafe near by as well. I was there early morning to avoid the crowds. If you come to Paris and you have time I recommended this place
Beautiful garden but always too busyâ€¦

Beautiful garden, free but still very clean. We arrived rather early in the morning, and it was very beautiful to feel the air and take many pictures, also you can enjoy your favorite croissant while sitting on the bench.
A hidden beauty very close to The Louvre. Well worth the short detour.  And! A fantastic place to run.
Lovely small garden in this place offers a good break from the busy and messy suburb around it
This place is amazing, the architecture is beyond words, it is a real hidden gem that is easy to walk by if you donâ€™t know it us there, well worth a visit when you are in Paris.
Lots of photo spots here. Worth the visit.
Had a really nice walk there as itâ€™s also not busy when we went.

Hidden germ, The historical impact of this building and park is often underestimated. Especially as it is located close to the overwhelming Louvre. It is worth visiting early in the morning, if lucky you will have the place all to yourself. The winter setting gives a special vibe.
It's amazing to see how massive these palaces really were in person.
Itâ€™s a normal sized park either a fountain and lots of trees itâ€™s perfect to eat something
A really nice park in the middle of the city. It's one of the most quiet parks because it's surrounded by a building. The trees create a nice gazebo effect so there's plenty of tree shadow.

This garden is absolutely stunning. Lush greenery, peaceful water features, flowersâ€¦, things that allow you to relax in the very busy city of Paris.  The area is very walkable. Although I came during the Olympics. Itâ€™s PARTIALLY during the Olympics. The layout is very poor. You have to go through many paths, most arenâ€™t indicated.  The only way you can see it is if youâ€™re trying to walk around the Place de la Concorde, since itâ€™s fully used for the Games.  You can still see some nice parts of it, but most is barricaded.

A beautiful parc to visit when in Paris M,  very close to the Louvre museum. The parc has a central fountain surrounded by little gardens and trees passages.  It is very fresh and you can easily enjoy the view and appreciate the silence while reading a book or eating a sandwich. There's a square at one of the entrances (Colette square entrance) decorated with a cylindrical columns of different sizes creating an optical illusion throughout the square. Perfect to take beautiful pictures.  Entrance is free,  and in summer the parc closes at 22h
